reviews.text: You can animals at a very short distance. One visit is a must and very few animals are available. And the maintenance is bit poor.
Nice place to visit with some crocodiles, monkeys, snakes and chimpanzees.  Decent parking area and many kiosks selling handicrafts. A medium restaurant in the parking area too.
A great way to spend the afternoon! Crocodiles, leopard, chimpanzees with the option to feed, good snake collection and more!

Though the place shows signs of neglect and some places look a bit run down, it is part of the must go places while you are in Bujumbura, Burundi.
Animals in the place include a leopard, chimps, 2 species of Crocs, several snake species (python, spitting cobra, Gabon viper, mamba just to name a few), an antelope and a few bird species.
 The staff are very helpful and more than willing to go out of their way to give you more background on most of the animals and stuff in there. Some staff are conversant in Swahili and French and of course the local dialect Kirundi. Though you would be out of luck if English is your only language. 
For a small fee you get to see the Crocs feeding and also get to touch and hold some of the snakes. The python was a  big treat for me! 
The place is easily accessible from town either on foot(about 20 minutes walk) or by car (5 mins drive). It's proximity to lake Tanganyika is also a plus as you can enjoy the spectacular views and if in luck, you'll get to see a few hippos basking in the shores of the lake.

Ideal for a perfect family day out, especially in the weekend. 
I would totally recommend it for a nice morning on a saturday or sunday.
Nice place;)But not for free!
Very near from Bujumbura (13km)  with easy access to the place
Excellent historic place. Nice view of the south side of the city!!
It have Omani story at this place the Omani Man meet Livingston and Stanley in Burundi

Local community apparenty put a fence and some person asking for 3 USD per person to visit... but issuing no receipts, claiming that the old book is completed and he did not receive a new one... And a whole group of scouts came by me and got in and on the stone for free...
Its ok for savers

Yeah, for people wants to chill and talk. 
The food and nice and cheap, i like the view new cayor has though. Especially at night.
Great service, nice rooms
Cool family place for full meals, snacks and beverages. At times waiters are overwhelmed so management should work on that.

Le restaurant est très célèbre pour son buffet de midi : il est très complet et a le mérite d'être abordable. Le service est quelques fois lent, surtout durant les heures de pointe, mais le personnel est très agréable. Ils ont aussi un service petit déjeuner qui est "royal".

They doing baby ear piercing here. The staff that work at the jewellery store are really friendly. They ways gave two staff to pierce baby ears as they do both at the same time to prevent added stress to the child which is perfect

Ignite Records is the best record store in the city. A real vinyl cavern that is packed with fairly priced records to suit a wide range of tastes. Rich (the owner) is a real gent, very knowledgeable and accommodating. The store is friendly and welcoming. Important we keep this indie going!
Legendary Birmingham fixture! Great place to get alternative/rock clothing and accessories  in an iconic location in the centre of town for nearly 50 years.

I have been going to Oasis for over 10 years now and every time you go in it is exciting, literally like a kid in a sweet shop. There is always something new and exciting going on. Highly recommend it!

Oasis has lost it appeal and is no longer a fashion markets. It's now full of rude and over priced tattoo parlours and pretentious "clothing shops". Not to mention the shops selling drug paraphernalia. 

Both inside and out the markets are rundown and are stuck in the 1980s and is in need of updating and bring in to this millennium. 
The markets also attracts the wrong kind of people and is a center of anti-social behaviour. I have often seen the police and security patrolling and moving people on. 

The Oasis markets are full of empty stalls and shops, which adds to the rundown feeling.

In conclusion, I would not recommend visting the markets for this reason.

Nice and quiet place with AIR CONDITIONING room where you can chill and talk about business in a convivial environment with affordable price and friendly staff members and it is located in the most frequently use road the Prince Louis Rwagasore Chausee
The food is great
My favorite place to be in bujumbura. Nice atmosphere, nice food and nice juice too!!!
Nice place
Good Cafe centre with reasonable price and service
very delicious food are found there.
Vraiment bon

Rooms are OK only for sleep,  try to watch TV, too much noise all the time,  specially in the morning.   Buffet Dinner is same all  the time,  they just enjoying in chicken...staff are friendly. WiFi slow
My father visting last 2 nights.Happy experience in d service

Breakfast is not that good, the dinner menu is even worse and overpriced tastes like everything is frozen microwave food. Today I came back to the room at 18:00 and it wasn't cleaned. The machines at the gym are old. The room I am in you can hear dogs barking all night.
Nice hotel with good service. Recommended
Great Hotel Suggestion to all indian Stay Here

Was very impressed! Good food, great for sharing. Highly suggest getting three or four items and sharing. Our friends like the yogurt drinks. 
Bonus, they have a great yard that our kids could all run around in and we can watch them form the tables.
A good place for Asian foods.

The best Indian food that I've had in all of east Africa.  Service was friendly and fast! The waiters were very quick to refill drinks.  Dinner in most other restaurants took about 2.5hrs. As a party of four here, we were served within 20 minutes and were done within 1hr 30.  We ended up eating here twice because it was so good.
Best restaurant in the world. I’m drooling now just thinking about it. Fast service, good food, friendly staff.
The food smell so good!! 👌
The Best Restaurant in Bujumbura. Very good foof, Excellenent service, profecional, Nice panoramic View, Price cheap ... chez Vaya have ALL the Quality ! I recommanded to all
The best Restaurant in town! Very cheap and good food. Panoramic View. They have the best Greek 🇬🇷 food.. Meze, Moussaka, Calamar, Gyros and Baklava 👌👍
Located in Kiriri with a nic and quite place
Nice place and very tastier foods
amazing place! Merci guys!
We’ve always been happy with our food there and the atmosphere is great. Out doors, view of the lake, and good food. Great pizza and brochettes. Family friendly.
Good place. Little old design by really styly. People joyful and peaceful silent
Always a good time! The waiters are fun, the pizzas are good and they have some interesting little bird creatures running around.

The good and the bad. The manager was kind enough to allow me to stay in the room for the published price even though I didn’t have a reservation. It is twice as expensive as what you see on Google. That shouldn’t be surprising because you are staying in an apartment, not just a room. They had nice hot showers. Beautiful birds in the garden and a view of the lake, although it was foggy the day I was there. 

The bad? Happy hour is loud. I mean some maniac screaming loud and no one liked and no one was there. After the “happy” hour screaming stopped people went out to eat. Staff were very slow, 20 minutes just to get a bill but food was good.
Very antique and staff is quite kind!

This is a decent fine dining restaurant, but for the money, the flavours didn’t hit the spot. The plates and food looks beautiful - like works of art - but I found the flavours didn’t match up to the presentation. The service was excellent though ! The waiters are attentive and really professional. Overall it’s a decent experience but the prices for the food don’t necessarily align.

Fantastic service from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. The food was incredible, and the bar selection was great as well. Highlights included the Double Smoked Manhattan, the Lobster from the 9-course meal, and dessert!
Without a doubt the best food I have ever had. I'm not one to go out of my comfort zone but at Eden everything was so delicious. Great service, beautiful restaurant and amazing food.

Absolutely worth the money! Our group of four tried the four part tasting menu. The service was outstanding. I really enjoyed all of the cheese options. I recommend getting the pork ribs for an entree and blueberry dark chocolate for dessert. My whole table agreed these tasted best. Be sure to ask for a table near the windows with the best mountain view-- I wish we had done this.
Nice breakfast nice place to see with  good views
Great kitchen! Professional service!

Built in 1953, the restaurant attached to the Tanganyika Hotel is an Art Deco dream. The many highlights of the menu include 'capitan' fish which is seasonal in variety and named after the custom of giving the best fish to the ship's captain.
Eten was ok.Onvriendelijke eigenaar.
Un lieu chargé d'histoire, un restaurant situé juste au bord du lac Tanganyika et qui offre un menu complet et très apprécié.
Formidable service d'accueil,beau repas, ils sont  les meilleurs .
The Best Restaurant in Bujumbura. Very good foof, Excellenent service, profecional, Nice panoramic View, Price cheap ... chez Vaya have ALL the Quality ! I recommanded to all
The best Restaurant in town! Very cheap and good food. Panoramic View. They have the best Greek 🇬🇷 food.. Meze, Moussaka, Calamar, Gyros and Baklava 👌👍
Located in Kiriri with a nic and quite place
Nice place and very tastier foods
